title: Engenheiro de dados
description:
Oportunidade de Emprego: Especialista em Engenharia de Dados na Inter & Co

Estamos à procura de Engenheiros de Dados altamente talentosos e motivados para se juntar à nossa equipe. Se você é um profissional apaixonado por dados, possui conhecimentos sólidos em Python, clean code e Apache Spark, esta pode ser a oportunidade perfeita para você. Além disso, se você também tiver experiência em computação em nuvem e Apache Airflow, consideraremos isso como um grande diferencial.

Responsabilidades

Atuar como referência técnica para equipe de engenharia de dados; Desenhar e desenvolver processos de engenharia de dados; Projetar, desenvolver e manter pipelines de dados escaláveis e eficientes; Monitorar recursos e custos de soluções desenvolvidas; Desenvolver códigos e soluções com foco em clean code, boas práticas e eficiência; Revisar e garantir qualidade de código; Implementar estratégias eficazes de ingestão e processamento; Colaborar com outras equipes de engenharia, ciência e análise de dados para desenvolver soluções de dados que impulsionem a eficiência e tomada de decisão orientada por dados.

Requisitos

Experiência sólida em Python e habilidades de programação; Conhecimentos sólidos de Spark e capacidade de implementar e otimizar jobs em pyspark; Experiência em clean code, boas práticas de desenvolvimento e implementação de testes automatizados; Familiaridade com arquiteturas de sistemas distribuídos e processamento de dados em larga escala; Habilidades de resolução de problemas complexos e capacidade de trabalhar em um ambiente inovador; Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autônoma e em equipe, demonstrando habilidades de comunicação e colaboração;

Diferenciais

Experiência em computação em nuvem (AWS, Azure ou Google Cloud Platform); Conhecimento em Apache Airflow para orquestração de pipelines de dados; Conhecimento de Apache Kafka.

Local de trabalho

Belo Horizonte / MG

Se você está em busca de desafios estimulantes e oportunidades de crescimento profissional, junte-se a nós!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Project Description: Small team of expert level engineers to deliver a changes across multiple service related to arbitrage.

Primary Stack: .Net, , Kafka, MSSQL, Azure

Responsibilities: - Collaborate with Portfolio managers and external teams - Derive requirements and match it with architecture solutions - Develop, test and deploy applications - L3 support the end users and business

Mandatory Skills Description: • Independent mindset, passion for technology, and an appetite for taking ownership, learning new technologies, and building innovative products. • Minimum 5 years of development experience in financial services or technology industries. • Full lifecycle experience including requirements gathering, implementation, testing, release, and support. • Strong technical and development skills in cross-platform environment, preferably in C# • Experience in Cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP) experience involving stateless and serverless solutions, event-driven architecture and cost optimization • Experience in IaC development with Terraform/OpenTofu/Bicep/Pulumi • Experience in container technologies (e.g., Docker, Podman) and container orchestration platforms (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker Swarm). • Experience with SQL development, preferably in a SQL Server environment. • Exposure to multi-threaded programming concepts. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Strong team player. • Bachelor's degree in computer science or engineering. • .NET Core and Entity Framework Core.

Nice-to-Have Skills Description: • Knowledge of arbitrage strategies • Experience with various financial products such as equities, derivatives, fixed income, etc., and related terminology. • Experience working with market data (e.g. Bloomberg APIs, etc.). • Experience with containerization and orchestrators. • Experience with Test Driven Development. • Experience with profiling and performance tuning techniques throughout the entire stack. • Experience with NoSQL databases, including document databases and graph databases. • Angular experience.

title: Infrastructure Engineer, Cloud
description:
We’re looking for someone to join our Engineering team at Ferrum. Are you interested in building services to help hospitals detect and eliminate the millions of medical errors that occur every year? If so, read on.

What You Will Do Ferrum is a distributed, fast-growing company where you will be wearing many hats and pitch in on different components and projects across the organization. That said, here are some examples of what you’ll do:

Working with application developers to design infrastructure and deploy services into multiple cloud environments Taking ownership of our build and deployment pipeline for application code and container images Implementing Infrastructure as Code best practices in order to maintain reliable systems Applying your Linux knowledge to maintain, extend, and scale our hybrid cloud platform

You Have Experience With:

At least 4 years of relevant DevOps experience At least 2 years of cost-effective infrastructure system design experience At least 3 years of maintaining production environments using Terraform and other IaC tools Writing binaries, libraries, and microservices in Go or Python Cost management with GCP or other cloud service providers Release management and deployment methodologies Bare metal and lower level infrastructure

Preferred Experience, But Not Required:

Google Cloud certification With Linux operating system internals, filesystems, disk/storage technologies and storage protocols A working knowledge of modern security practices (ex: remediation plans, CVEs, firewalls, intrusion detection systems, vulnerability scanners) Linux and physical networking (ex: routing, switching, Wireshark) as well as networking constructs in cloud environments

You love efficiency and automation.

Your work at Ferrum will have a huge impact on the business. You take pride in developing scripts, tools, and services to help the team perform at a high level and scale to new challenges. You should be proficient with BASH and familiar with Python--but Go is even better.

You ensure the security of our systems and the privacy of our customers' data.

You keep up to date with security bulletins and CVEs. You’ve been a part of or even led remediation plans to swiftly implement fixes. You can provide architecture guidance for hybrid cloud solutions and implement them when necessary. You have experience and opinions on vulnerability scanners, firewalls, and intrusion detection systems.

You strive to take ownership of a project from ideation to delivery and maintenance.

Your experience provides a framework for you to work independently on several initiatives which will provide significant and measurable value to our customers. Seek opportunities to develop horizontal technologies that benefit multiple teams. Build developer tools to increase efficiency of all teams at Ferrum.

You communicate and document everything.

At Ferrum, we are a distributed team. A culture of sharing and documentation allows everyone to work together. We are looking for a practitioner of clear documentation that is well-maintained.

And most importantly, you want to make a positive and lasting impact on the world.

You understand that technology has the power to improve people’s lives and enrich our society.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Who WE are Bearaby is an award-winning Direct to Consumer (DTC) company on a mission to bring comfort and relief to people of all ages who are searching for calm in a complex world. We create beautiful and functional products, including our flagship weighted blankets, that are sustainably manufactured from organic materials and innovative upcycled fabrics - loom to lap. We believe that restorative rest should be simple, natural, and drug-free - and that it's time to ditch the negative stigmas around healthy habits like napping and sleeping-in for a calmer, more collected world.

Role Summary Bearaby is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Graphic Designer to support our creative and digital teams with stunning digital visuals for a range of digital mediums, such as website, email, paid ads, and social media. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in designing user-centric interfaces and creating engaging visual experiences that are optimized for conversions, in a way that adheres to our brand identity. An ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio showcasing a deep understanding of both graphic design principles and paid marketing strategies, with a proven track record of designing successful marketing campaigns for ecommerce.

Duties and Responsibilities Ads creation: support our paid media team by creating marketing campaigns that includes images, videos and stitching user-generated content with overlay text and other compelling visuals. UI/UX Design: develop and implement visually appealing user interfaces for our website that are optimized independently for mobile and desktop, ensuring designs are user-friendly, responsive and aligned with best practices for UX/UI. Email design: use Figma, Canva or other design platforms to create marketing emails that are visually compelling, effectively communicated and follow the brand guidelines. Wireframing & Prototyping: Create detailed wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes to communicate design concepts and user flows effectively. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, marketers, and product development, to ensure designs are executed accurately and meet project objectives and timelines. Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, design tools, and best practices. Bring fresh ideas and innovative solutions to enhance our eCommerce platform. Brand Partnerships: Support brand partnerships by creating product mock-ups for a range of different products, in a manner that is both innovative and true to the brand.

Who You Are Strong creative with an eye for great design that suits the brand style and addresses functional concerns. Knowledgeable and skilled in building ads, landing pages, adapting typography and design to the brand’s UI/UX guidelines, photography, and retouching images. A flexible thinker who is comfortable taking on feedback and can work with strategic direction A team player with the ability to work closely across teams in a fast-paced startup environment A proactive self-starter with top notch written and verbal communication skills A strong communicator with excellent interpersonal skills at all levels, which include both written and verbal communication skills. Exceptionally detailed, with the ability to create pixel-perfect designs and ensure high-quality outcomes. Comfortable with working in G Suite, monday.com, and Slack Adaptable, flexible and resilient, with excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills.

Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, preferably a BFA with 2-3 years of graphic design experience, with a strong focus on digital marketing ads and email design. Experience working with design tools such as inDesign, Photoshop, Figma, Illustrator, and/or other related software. Strong understanding of HTML/CSS is a plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Experience working with a digitally native brand or branding/digital marketing agency Strong problem-solving skills with a creative and analytical approach to design challenges. Experience working for an international company in a cross-cultural context. A passion for sustainable wellness and restorative rest is a bonus!

We Offer Competitive salary Paid annual leave Birthday off Unlimited Naps Supportive colleagues and a high performing team Access to training, resources and network

title: Analista FP&A Sr
description:
UCB é reconhecida como a principal empresa de soluções de armazenamento de energia do Brasil e da América Latina. Desde sua fundação em 1973, a empresa tem liderado a agenda de transição energética no país. Combinando vasta experiência em manufatura de eletrônicos e desenvolvimento de soluções de armazenamento de energia. A sede administrativa está localizada em São Paulo, possui plantas industriais, localizadas em Manaus - AM e Extrema - MG, um escritório em Porto Velho e parceria comercial com dois escritórios na Ásia (Seul e Shenzhen). A UCB é uma das empresas signatária do Pacto Global da ONU e está entre as mil maiores empresas do Brasil. Contrata para o seu quadro de colaboradores

:

Analista FP&A Sr

Análise e Planejamento Financeiro:

Desenvolver projeções financeiras e análises de desempenho por meio da elaboração de DRE, BP e Fluxo de Caixa (budget, forecast, rolling forecast de 12 meses, entre outros), garantindo um planejamento estratégico sólido e alinhado aos objetivos organizacionais. Gestão Orçamentária e Performance Financeira:

Elaborar e consolidar o planejamento orçamentário, acompanhando os resultados financeiros e identificando riscos e oportunidades para otimização da performance econômica da companhia. Análise Financeira e Tomada de Decisão:

Fornecer análises estratégicas sobre custos, preços, despesas e receitas para suporte à alta gestão, áreas comercial, industrial, operacional e diretoria financeira, influenciando a tomada de decisão. Desenvolvimento de Relatórios Gerenciais

: Criar dashboards e relatórios analíticos em Excel e Power BI, disseminando informações financeiras para diferentes níveis organizacionais e promovendo insights para melhoria dos processos. Apoio a Gestão:

Preparar e validar materiais para suporte às reuniões da alta gestão, assegurando informações precisas e alinhadas aos objetivos estratégicos. Compliance e Governança:

Assegurar a conformidade com políticas internas e regulatórias, apoiando processos de auditoria e controle financeiro. Interação Interdepartamental:

Atuar em colaboração com as áreas comercial, contábil, fiscal, custos, industrial e Supply Chain, promovendo a integração e a eficiência dos processos financeiros. Inovação e Otimização de Processos:

Propor novos modelos de análise financeira e indicadores de desempenho, fomentando a inovação e a melhoria contínua na área de planejamento financeiro.

É importante para nós que você tenha Formação em Economia, Ciências Contábeis, Administração, Engenharia ou áreas afins; Experiência com Excel; Experiência em DRE, BP e Fluxo de Caixa.

Será um diferencial se você possuir Experiência com sistema Protheus; Conhecimento em SQL e Power BI.

Benefícios Assistência Médica SulAmérica Assistência Odontológica SulAmérica Vale Refeição de R$ 42,00 por dia Estacionamento no local Seguro de Vida em Grupo Wellhub (Gympass) Day Off no dia do aniversário

Local Vila Olímpia - SP (Presencial)

Diversidade A UCB apoia a diversidade e incentiva pessoas negras, profissionais PCD, mulheres, pessoas das comunidades LGBTQIAPN+ e profissionais de qualquer idade a se candidatarem a esta vaga.

title: Representante Comercial Autonomo
description:
Responsabilidades Efetivar a introdução da Linha de Produtos Pet Life em redes de Supermercados e Distribuidores na sua região de Atuação. Segue site Pet Life 20 anos no mercado veterinario.

Qualificações Possuir carteira de clientes ativos e interesse em agregar novos produtos no seu portifolio.

title: Informatica IICS Developer
description:
Apgar is looking to recruit

an

Informatica IICS Developer

to join our dynamic team in

Porto Alegre

- Brazil

and contribute to the development and integration of cloud-based data solutions using

Informatica Integration Cloud Services (IICS) .

What we offer you: By joining us you will… · Be joining a global team considered by industry specialists (e.g. Gartner) as one of the World Top20 best companies in the field of Data Management and a team awarded on the top5 “Best Places to Work” in Portugal. · Be part of a project team and senior consultants that will guide and support you · Implementing data solutions for world leading international companies.

Some of the advantages of working with us.. · Flexible working schedule and ability to work in a hybrid mode (including 6 weeks a year fully remote from wherever you agree on) · Competitive salary with benefits · Be supported by a senior consultant (mentor) that will help in your career development · A team spirit that will make you feel at home · Be part of a team located in 4 different continents where diversity is as common as the air your breath

What you'll be doing: Design, develop, and deploy cloud-based data integration workflows and solutions using

Informatica Integration Cloud Services (IICS) . Collaborate with stakeholders to understand integration requirements and translate them into scalable, robust solutions. Build, test, and optimize ETL pipelines for efficient data transformation and integration between systems. Maintain and troubleshoot existing data integration processes, ensuring seamless operation and performance. Provide technical expertise and support for cloud-based data integration initiatives in multinational projects. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data consistency, accuracy, and accessibility. Identify and implement process improvements and best practices to enhance overall system performance. Stay updated on the latest developments in

IICS

and related cloud data integration technologies.

You are… Mandatory Skills: A minimum of

2 years of hands-on experience

with Informatica Integration Cloud Services (IICS). Proficiency in creating and managing ETL pipelines and workflows in a cloud environment. Experience in using and developing Application Integration Processes Strong understanding of data integration concepts, tools, and best practices. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a creative approach to challenges. Proven experience working in multinational projects and delivering strong results. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interact effectively with team members and stakeholders. Experience with

MDM projects

or a strong understanding of data governance principles is a plus. Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.

Preferable Skills: Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. Proficiency in HTTP REST Basic Scripting skills (Linux Bash, Python, etc...) Experience integration with Salesforce systems and databases Experience with other Informatica tools like Informatica PowerCenter or Informatica Data Quality. Exposure to Agile project management methodologies.

Who are we? Apgar is a leading company in the development and implementation of data platforms, recognized by analysts as one of the world leaders in this area. We support our clients in their digital transformation, through the global team that has more than 200 consultants in our offices located in Europe (Portugal, UK, France, Switzerland, Cyprus), The Americas (USA and Brazil), Middle East (Lebanon) and South Asia and Oceania (Singapore and Australia). Our consultants work on developing Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Integration, Advanced Data Analytics and Machine Learning solutions among others.

Let's talk about your future in the world of data management software?

We firmly believe in an ethical approach to recruitment, where every candidate is treated with consideration, fairness, and transparency throughout the selection process, with the aim of respecting diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities.

title: iOS Developer
description:
We are looking for a iOS engineer to build discovery experiences that serve the Adoption mission within our native app on surfaces such as the feed, the community tab and the post page.

What you’ll Do ● Move fast while balancing quality. We can’t afford extensive processes, and we also can’t afford show-stopping bugs. We need people who can balance speed with quality while quickly building brand-new products. ● Contribute meaningfully to team strategy. We give everyone a seat at the table and encourage active participation in planning for the future. Don’t just come along for the ride. ● Communicate effectively, within the team and across disciplines. Work closely with product managers and designers to craft compelling user experiences. What we’re looking for ● 4+ years mobile development experience with multiple parts of the iOS stack. We develop with Swift. Experience with Combine or RxSwift is strongly preferred. Experience with Storekit framework, Texture, UIKit, or SwiftUI are nice to have, but not required. ● Ability to design and implement complex distributed systems operating under high load. ● Experience developing customer-facing public applications is preferred. ● Entrepreneurial spirit. On our team, everyone needs to act like a startup CEO. You must be self-directed, innovative, and biased towards action in fast-paced environments. You live to build new things and thrive in ambiguity and even failure.

● Excellent communication skills. You must be able to collaborate effectively with teams in a fully-remote environment, and discuss complex topics with technical and non-technical audiences.

title: Digital Designer
description:
The Position The main focus of this role is to design ads and landing pages to lift the brand design of our clients. You’ll execute storyboards from creative strategists while bringing in art direction and best practices from across the web and social. The goal of the role is to design high-quality digital assets in a fast-paced environment to improve client ROAS goals.

The ideal candidate for this position will have a portfolio featuring multiple examples of social ads, web design, and will be able to demonstrate a strong understanding of the latest digital trends and emerging technologies.

Required Skills A dynamic portfolio showcasing strengths in typography, design, visual storytelling, campaign concept creation, and art direction across all mediums Strong understanding of Figma and Adobe CS Exceptional art direction and typography skills Work collaboratively on teams to develop creative solutions Incredibly detail-oriented Open and receptive to creative direction and design feedback Someone who works backward on a problem before moving forward towards a solution Understanding of leading social platforms and the responsive web Experience working with eCommerce and DTC brands

Responsibilities Work with creative briefs to design social ads for performance advertising Manage the art direction for multiple clients by building out digital assets, templates, and inspiration boards Work on multiple clients' ad creatives each week to build out extensive libraries for each funnel stage Lead the design of responsive landing pages Driven by details. You’re meticulous, thorough and enjoy being precise

Company Overview Lilo Social is a growth marketing agency focused on full-funnel marketing delivering best-in-class paid media and creative services for a wide range of eCommerce brands focused on scaling. We work across the entire life-cycle of the customer journey covering content creation, ad production, paid media, conversion rate optimization, and email/sms marketing. Select clients include Cheribundi, BAUER, Bearaby, and many more.

title: Advogado(a) Pleno | Contencioso Cível Estratégico
description:
Somos um escritório de advocacia com mais de 170 integrantes sediado em São Paulo.

Responsabilidades

Condução de casos de alta complexidade; Definição de estratégias e análise de documentos; Atendimento de clientes em reuniões / e-mails / alinhamento de estratégias; Elaboração de pareceres/legal opinions e relatórios; Participação em audiências e sustentação oral em julgamentos; Realização de despachos junto a magistrados; Pesquisas jurisprudenciais; Elaboração de artigos e informativos com temas relacionados às áreas de atuação; Gestão de estagiários.

Requisitos

title: Broker | Trader de commodities agrícolas
description:
Responsabilidades: Prospecção de compradores, fornecedores e vendedores de produtos agroindustriais. Comercialização de produtos e serviços no mercado interno e/ou internacional. Acompanhamento da execução das operações negociadas em conjunto com as demais áreas da companhia. Gestão de Risco visando mitigar eventuais cenários para o cliente e para a empresa. Avaliação dos resultados, acompanhamento de indicadores de desempenho visando o cumprimento de metas pré-estabelecidas pela companhia. Assistência em estratégias e fixações conforme aprovação dos clientes. Monitoramento de mercado. Relacionamento Interpessoal, comercial e ativo com os clientes.

Perfil: Habilidade de comunicação. Capacidade de propor soluções, e de construir relacionamentos de modo a desenvolver parcerias. Acurada visão estratégica a fim de converter oportunidades em negócios. Habilidades interpessoais e de grupo. Persistência e eficiência no cumprimento de todas as atividades.

title: Desenvolvedor Python Sênior
description:
A

Juntos Somos Mais

é uma startup de tecnologia atuando no mercado da construção civil desde 2018 que tem como acionistas três gigantes do mercado: Votorantim Cimentos, Gerdau e Tigre.

Fazemos isso por meio de tecnologia, com produtos próprios, parcerias, aquisições e com um time empreendedor, de alta performance, que é movido pela nossa paixão em transformar vidas! Hoje contamos com mais de 40 marcas participantes, mais de 1.2 milhões de membros entre lojistas, vendedores e profissionais de obra, 100 mil lojas e movimentamos mais de 10 bilhões de reais em nossa Loja Virtual em 2024, e crescemos mais a cada dia.

O nosso time é empreendedor e apaixonado por propor as melhores soluções para os nossos usuários, fortalecendo o varejo de materiais de construção e impactando a vida de milhares de pessoas. Através disso, construímos relações sólidas para sermos o maior ecossistema da construção civil. O seu desafio será criar e implementar as melhores soluções para suportar o negócio, privilegiando sempre a qualidade, a experiência dos membros e a partilha das melhores práticas. A nossa equipe é empreendedora e apaixonada pelo propósito de fortalecer o comércio de materiais de construção e transformar a vida dos profissionais que constroem sonhos. O nosso sonho é grande e a vontade de fazer mais é o que nos move!

Responsabilidades: Desenvolver e suportar aplicações para atender às necessidades do negócio; Construir um código com qualidade e testável; Estudar e implementar novas tecnologias aderentes à plataforma; Apoiar na manutenção e evolução da arquitetura dos sistemas; Atuar em time ágil.

Requisitos: Domínio de Python e atuação em projetos com Django; Modelagem de APIs: desenvolvimento e consumo (REST); Domínio de Testes Automatizados (unitário e integrado); Experiência com NoSQL databases; Experiência com Docker e Kubernetes; Experiência atuando com meios de pagamento; Ter atuado em times ágeis (Kanban, Scrum) e gostar de atuar com time multi-funcional.

INFORMAÇÕES ADICIONAIS

Nosso processo seletivo Aqui no processo seletivo da #Juntos, valorizamos o aprendizado e o desenvolvimento conjunto. Acreditamos que temos muito a aprender e a ensinar, então levamos isto para todas as fases dessa jornada!

Benefícios de ser #Juntos Por aqui você terá:

Remuneração variável

para reconhecer seu esforço e desempenho; Plano odontológico e de saúde : Amil, com co-participação de 30% paga no momento da utilização. O plano é extensível para cônjuge e filhos. Vale-refeição/alimentação

com o cartão Flash – você decide como utilizar! Wellhub

– Academia e saúde do corpo onde você preferir! Zenklub

– Cuide da sua saúde mental com o nosso apoio; Auxílio creche

– Para cuidar do desenvolvimento de quem você ama; Auxílio Home Office

– Para transformar seu ambiente de trabalho em casa; Kit Ergonomia

– Monte sua estação de trabalho do jeito que você quiser; Licença maternidade de 180 dias e licença parental de 30 dias

– Apoio completo para quem se torna pai ou mãe, incluindo casais homoafetivos e famílias que adotam ou obtêm a guarda judicial de crianças; InvestPass

– Para cuidar da sua saúde financeira; Massagem no escritório : Toda quarta-feira temos massagem disponível no escritório. Desconto em escolas de idiomas : Firmamos parcerias com a Cultura Inglesa e com a Elleve, oferecendo descontos para os colaboradores. Desconto em cursos de universidades

para você e seus dependentes; SESC

– Benefício de lazer, cultura e saúde para a sua família; Parceria com a Posher (exclusivo para São Paulo - SP)

– Descontos em serviços como manicure, massagem, lavanderia e mais; Day off no Dia da Família

– Para você dedicar tempo àqueles que mais ama; Day off de aniversário

– Comemore o seu dia de forma especial; Vacinação contra gripe

– Cuidando da sua saúde no inverno; Medicina do trabalho

– Para garantir que você esteja sempre bem.

Diversidade e Inclusão Acreditamos que a diversidade é enriquecedora. Por isso, incentivamos que as pessoas que trabalham aqui tenham a liberdade para ser quem são de verdade. Somos feitos de gente, e valorizamos a importância do toque mais pessoal de cada um para a construção de um time forte, empático e divertido!

title: Consultor de Leads
description:
Estamos em busca de um Consultor de Leads para se juntar à nossa equipe no Grupo Itavema! O Consultor de Leads desempenha um papel essencial no processo de vendas, qualificando leads recebidos da montadora e de outras mídias, garantindo que a experiência de compra seja excelente e contribuindo para a conversão de leads em vendas de automóveis. Se você tem experiência em qualificação de leads, é dinâmico e busca crescer profissionalmente em uma empresa que valoriza o sucesso coletivo, esta oportunidade é para você!

O Consultor de Leads é responsável por qualificar os leads, realizar o primeiro atendimento, transferir para os vendedores ou agendar visitas, acompanhando o progresso no sistema MR Sales e garantindo que as expectativas do cliente sejam atendidas durante o processo de compra.

Principais Atividades:

Qualificar leads e executar o padrão de atendimento, gerando conversões em vendas. Transferir leads qualificados para o vendedor ou agendar visitas de clientes. Acompanhar a evolução dos leads no sistema MR Sales. Monitorar e relatar métricas de desempenho, ajustando estratégias conforme necessário. Participar de treinamentos e alinhar-se às metas e estratégias da empresa.

Requisitos Técnicos:

Experiência com ferramentas de CRM (MR Sales) e automação de marketing. Conhecimento em prospecção e qualificação de leads. Familiaridade com diferentes tipos de leads e plataformas de captação. Entendimento dos produtos e seus benefícios.

title: Azure Data Engineer (Relocation to Portugal)
description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines: Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.

What are we looking for? +5 years of experience in Data Engineering; Microsoft Azure covering - designing, building, testing, and maintaining cloud applications and related services. Strong understanding of core concepts - Azure data storage, Azure compute, data connections, APIs, Databricks, Data Factory, Data Lake, and Azure Synapse on the cloud. English level B2 or higher; Willingness to move to Portugal (Mandatory).

What do we have to offer you? Health Insurance; Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model; Hybrid work model; A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring; Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different? Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning; Reference prizes and birthday present; We don’t have a dress code; We call you by your name and we all address each other informally; Coffee and snacks at your disposal; You will grow in good company. Isn´t that the best way to improve professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase? We are waiting for you!

We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

title: Sales Manager
description:
About Libiao Robotics

Libiao Robotics is the global pioneer of intelligent sorting robots in 2016, and the world's leading supplier of flexible intelligent sorting solutions, creating the world's first portable, modular and automated unit sorting system. original robot tote handling system,The company integrates logistics automation, research and development, production and sales of intelligent equipment.

Now, Libiao's intelligent sorting system has been widely applied across various industries and scenarios, including express delivery, supermarkets, retail, shoes & garments, medicine, catering, cold storage, book publications, manufacturing, etc. In addition, over 50,000 sorting robots are running in many countries and regions such as the US, Japan, South Korea, Australia and Europe.

Responsibilities: Maintain and manage the current End-User customer relationships, and develop sales pipeline to achieve annual sales & revenue targets in the local area; Cooperate deeply with the overseas sales channels, and assisted them to formulate business plan, and build up the strong long-term relationships; Generate new business opportunities, and develop the typical customers; Collect and analyze the market trends, and feedback the demands of customers and market, and promote the development of business.

Qualifications: Bachelor degree or above, science and engineering majors and those have overseas study or work background are preferred; Two year’s or above sales or business development experience in logistics automation equipment, logistics integrators, intelligent manufacturing for local area, or those have the technical support and plan & design experiences for above industries are preferred; Strong business perception and negotiation skills, pressure resistance, and career ambition; Good communication skills, fluent in English, and adapt to overseas long-term business trips.

Corporate Culture: Vision: Make the world more efficient

Mission: Focus on flexible automation of the entire logistics process

Goal: Become leading company in logistics robot industry

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Who WE are Bearaby is an award-winning Direct to Consumer (DTC) company on a mission to bring comfort and relief to people of all ages who are searching for calm in a complex world. We create beautiful and functional products, including our flagship weighted blankets, that are sustainably manufactured from organic materials and innovative upcycled fabrics - loom to lap. We believe that restorative rest should be simple, natural, and drug-free - and that it's time to ditch the negative stigmas around healthy habits like napping and sleeping-in for a calmer, more collected world.

Role Summary Bearaby is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Graphic Designer to support our creative and digital teams with stunning digital visuals for a range of digital mediums, such as website, email, paid ads, and social media. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in designing user-centric interfaces and creating engaging visual experiences that are optimized for conversions, in a way that adheres to our brand identity. An ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio showcasing a deep understanding of both graphic design principles and paid marketing strategies, with a proven track record of designing successful marketing campaigns for ecommerce.

Duties and Responsibilities Ads creation: support our paid media team by creating marketing campaigns that includes images, videos and stitching user-generated content with overlay text and other compelling visuals. UI/UX Design: develop and implement visually appealing user interfaces for our website that are optimized independently for mobile and desktop, ensuring designs are user-friendly, responsive and aligned with best practices for UX/UI. Email design: use Figma, Canva or other design platforms to create marketing emails that are visually compelling, effectively communicated and follow the brand guidelines. Wireframing & Prototyping: Create detailed wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes to communicate design concepts and user flows effectively. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, marketers, and product development, to ensure designs are executed accurately and meet project objectives and timelines. Innovation: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, design tools, and best practices. Bring fresh ideas and innovative solutions to enhance our eCommerce platform. Brand Partnerships: Support brand partnerships by creating product mock-ups for a range of different products, in a manner that is both innovative and true to the brand.

Who You Are Strong creative with an eye for great design that suits the brand style and addresses functional concerns. Knowledgeable and skilled in building ads, landing pages, adapting typography and design to the brand’s UI/UX guidelines, photography, and retouching images. A flexible thinker who is comfortable taking on feedback and can work with strategic direction A team player with the ability to work closely across teams in a fast-paced startup environment A proactive self-starter with top notch written and verbal communication skills A strong communicator with excellent interpersonal skills at all levels, which include both written and verbal communication skills. Exceptionally detailed, with the ability to create pixel-perfect designs and ensure high-quality outcomes. Comfortable with working in G Suite, monday.com, and Slack Adaptable, flexible and resilient, with excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills.

Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, preferably a BFA with 2-3 years of graphic design experience, with a strong focus on digital marketing ads and email design. Experience working with design tools such as inDesign, Photoshop, Figma, Illustrator, and/or other related software. Strong understanding of HTML/CSS is a plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Experience working with a digitally native brand or branding/digital marketing agency Strong problem-solving skills with a creative and analytical approach to design challenges. Experience working for an international company in a cross-cultural context. A passion for sustainable wellness and restorative rest is a bonus!

We Offer Competitive salary Paid annual leave Birthday off Unlimited Naps Supportive colleagues and a high performing team Access to training, resources and network

title: DENIM Fashion Designer
description: DENIM Fashion DesignerABOUT SHEIN:SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!CAREERS AT SHEIN:We Commit to InclusionWe are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.We Empower Talents with Diverse CareersAt SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.We Engage with Global CulturesSHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.Responsabilities:1. Undertake monthly theme development direction and output weekly theme development plan;2. Collect style images through different channels and complete selection and inventory of styles;3. Draw style sketches, match fabrics and accessories, create design specification sheets to ensure the accuracy of product development;4. Communicate product style structure, review garment samples, ensuring satisfaction with garment fit and sample implementation;5. Review product photoshoots, ensure product image quality, and complete product listing;6. Regularly review product listing data, complete product optimization;7. Professional competence development and empowerment.Requirements:1. Degree in fashion design; proficient in English.2. Have 2 years or more of denim design experience, able to independently review denim patterns. Experience in denim brands or denim factories are preferred.3. Good at summarizing and analyzing slow-selling items, understanding customer needs, making quick responses, and applying them to new product development;4. Proficient in computer graphic design and office software usage skills;5. Familiar with denim supply chain, possessing in-depth knowledge of denim fabrics and production processes.6. Meticulous, efficient, responsible, and able to work under pressure as required by the job.7. High comprehension, cheerful personality, good communication skills, and a serious and responsible work attitude.At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

title: Machine Learning Engineer | Sponsor US H1B
description:
Project Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Machine Learning and Data Engineer to join our team. This role involves developing sophisticated image-based solutions for plant phenotyping and pulling, stitching, and wrangling data from various sources for advanced analytics. The successful candidate will work on a cross-functional team, collaborating closely with crop scientists, plant pathologists, cloud engineers, and data scientists to enable access to relevant data and deploy machine-learning models and solutions.

Responsibilities: Develop and implement image-based solutions for quantifying various traits and features of plants. Pull data from first and third-party sources, prepare it for analysis by filtering, tagging, joining, parsing, and normalizing datasets. Collaborate with team members to research data sources, design and deploy data loaders, and ensure the availability of data for analytical activities. Provide technical expertise in the design and implementation of data management and architecture solutions. Develop, evolve, and implement concepts of data ops in partnership with cloud and ML engineers. Architect, develop, deliver, and support ML products and solutions, ensuring successful deployment into production. Automate model training, testing, and deployment processes. Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.

Requirements: Master’s degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, Physics, Mathematics, or related fields. Deep understanding and experience with Image Theory, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Python Programming, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. Strong experience in designing and implementing large-scale data processing, analysis, and exploration solutions. Proficiency in R, Python, advanced SQL skills, and a good understanding of data management principles. Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or GCP preferred) and deploying CI/CD pipelines. Knowledge of Git, PySpark, Data Bricks, and database management (SQL/PLSQL/Snowflake preferred). Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently and collaborate across teams. 2+ years of industry or academia experience in image processing, computer vision, or related fields.

Work Details: Location: Remote, candidates must work in the PST time zone. Work Hours: 40 hours per week. We sponsor US work visa after 1 year of service

title: SAP Data Migration Lead Consultant
description:
ABOUT US Syniti

is

the

enterprise data partner, empowering anyone who relies on data to make business-critical decisions by delivering data they can trust through a unique combination of intelligent software and experts who deeply understand the role of data in enterprise growth.

Trusted by the Fortune 2000, Syniti helps leading businesses reconfigure the role of enterprise data from afterthought to foundational first step; enabling them to unlock valuable insights that ignite growth, reduce risk, and expand their competitive advantage.

Syniti’s

Data First

philosophy and enterprise data management platform supports data migration, data quality, data replication, data matching, master data management, analytics, data governance, and data strategy in a single, unified solution.

As an innovative, global leader in Enterprise Data Management, the combination of our award-winning software platform and premier consultants creates a unique advantage for leading enterprises. Syniti is also a preferred data solution used by the

world’s top system integrators .

Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with offices in 25 countries around the world, Syniti operates in all global regions and industry verticals, and maintains a 100% client success rate across thousands of complex data projects and initiatives.

The ROLE We are recruiting talented and motivated individuals to join our team delivering data projects for clients across the globe. As a lead data migration consultant at Syniti, you will be responsible for managing a team of migration consultants on all aspects of data work for a process area/workstream. You will work closely with functional consultants and key customer resources, gathering requirements through workshops, building conversion objects, and driving your team’s value through all data project phases. You will be responsible for making sure that your team uses your data skills and the Syniti data management platform to assess and iterate through design, build, and deployment, ensuring that the highest customer value is derived from your assigned objects. As a lead member of a Syniti Data Migration team, you will execute against the best practices for successful business transformation and become skilled in the strongest platform to meet all of our customer’s needs.

WHAT YOU WILL DO After an initial training period, a Lead Data Migration Consultant will be expected to:

Demonstrate a strong understanding of Syniti’s Data Migration methodology. Demonstrate strong proficiency in Syniti’s tools, working to prescribed development standards. Good understanding of business processes for one or more assigned functional area, and the ability to quickly learn about new areas. Effectively manage a small team of data migration consultants, to meet assigned responsibilities against the overall project plan. Demonstrate a strong knowledge of underlying technical data structures and definitions of assigned functional process area. Develop data migration rules and reports in the Syniti’s tools as per supplied specification. Evaluate and contribute to ongoing data migration design for assigned process area through data analysis, reporting and collaboration with on-site Syniti and client colleagues. Create and maintain data load programs. Maintain related documentation and clearly communicate status to Syniti Team Leadership and customer PMO. Execution of end-to-end data loads and reconciliations. Support and mentor junior colleagues.

WHAT IT TAKES Degree level qualification in Computer Science (or other technology related field). Experience in ETL / Data Migration / Data Quality / Data Analysis. Experience managing resources to deliver a collective goal/responsibility. Functional ERP experience. Project experience across multiple ERP implementations. Database experience - SQL Server, Oracle etc. Customer facing skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Willingness to travel according to project requirements up to 100%.

WHAT WE OFFER Autonomy and Trust:

Trust that you are proficient at what you do. At Syniti, you will find a supportive environment and access to learning tools, with minimal micromanagement. Growth Opportunities:

We are growing rapidly, offering you the chance to grow with us, shape our journey, and share in our success story. Collaborative Support:

We value collaboration and support each other, ensuring you won't stand alone in your endeavors. Diversity of Stories:

Genuine interest in your unique story and journey. We celebrate individual achievements and want to hear everyone's story. Recognition:

We appreciate and celebrate individual achievements, acknowledging the contribution of each team member. Open Organization:

We embrace an open and inclusive culture, where hierarchies are minimized, and access is ensured across the board. Everyone is valued, and ideas are welcomed.

title: Desenvolvedor(a) FullStack Sênior
description:
SIS Innov & Tech

Há mais de 20 anos no mercado, somos uma consultoria estratégica de Inovação e Transformação Digital. Nossa especialidade é impulsionar as demandas de nossos clientes, integrando processos, pessoas e tecnologia de alta performance. Estamos com uma oportunidade para o nosso time corporativo para atuar como:

Desenvolvedor(a) FullStack Sênior

Responsabilidades: Desenvolver, manter e otimizar aplicações web utilizando .NET Core e Angular; Implementar novas funcionalidades e melhorias nos sistemas existentes; Criar e manter APIs RESTful e serviços de backend escaláveis; Desenvolver interfaces responsivas e interativas utilizando Angular; Trabalhar em colaboração com outras áreas, como QA, Infraestrutura e Negócio; Diagnosticar e solucionar problemas técnicos de software e banco de dados; Garantir a qualidade do código seguindo boas práticas e padrões estabelecidos; Elaborar e manter documentação técnica dos sistemas desenvolvidos. Requisitos: Sólida experiência com desenvolvimento em .NET Core (C#); Experiência avançada com Angular (versão 8 ou superior); Conhecimento em Entity Framework, Dapper e LINQ; Experiência com desenvolvimento de APIs REST; Experiência com bancos de dados relacionais (Oracle); Conhecimento em arquitetura de software, design patterns e boas práticas de desenvolvimento; Experiência com controle de versão (Git, SVN, etc.); Boa comunicação e habilidade para trabalhar em equipe. Diferenciais: Conhecimento em integração contínua e entrega contínua (CI/CD); Experiência com Cloud Computing (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud); Conhecimento em Docker e Kubernetes; Experiência com metodologias ágeis (Scrum, Kanban); A vaga é remota, porém se a pessoa tiver disponibilidade para atuar 1x presencial por semana em Alphaville seria um diferencial.

Benefícios CLT: Vale Refeição - Cartão flash Plano de saúde Plano odontológico Auxílio home office Alura Crédito Aniversário – Cartão Flash

Todas as nossas oportunidades de trabalho estão abertas para pessoas com deficiência. #VemPraSIS #SomosSIS

title: Lead Data Architect
description:
Building a risk applications and tools for innovative international top-tier hedge fund from the ground up, comprising the systems for traders, pre-trade checks and analysis, risks and limits management, reports of trading activities, FIX connectivity, market data providers connectivity (e.g. Bloomberg B-pipe), etc The Team is focused on the development and maintenance of various database applications supporting Risk Management. The successful candidate will have considerable and proven experience in database design, PL/SQL development, a good working knowledge of end-user and server-side data processing techniques, a good understanding of SDLC and agile development methodologies.

Responsibilities: Developing business friendly data models. Migration from SQL Server -> Fabric and/or Azure

Mandatory Skills Description: - Strong understanding of data modelling and data quality principles - Experience across data architecture and data warehousing techniques and practices is essential. - Proven experience in designing and developing data models using industry best practices - Experience in using code management and CI/CD tools such as Github, Azure Devops, Jenkins, Bamboo etc. - Senior (10+ years) MS SQL Server developer/architect. - Azure fabric serviсe experience - 10+ years of experience working with ETL tools such as SSIS, ADF or similar. - Good understanding and demonstrated experience working with Power Query (M query language) and DAX. - Management of Power BI datasets, workspaces and the associated security requirements. - Familiarity with Power BI Premium capabilities, Power BI Rest APIs, Python and Databricks will be highly regarded. - Extensive experience designing and developing reports and performance metrics from complex and disparate platforms

Nice-to-Have Skills Description: - Experience with Azure - Risks trading system development experience. - Business knowledge in trading domain / capital

Languages: English: B2 Upper Intermediate
